channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: C+CC to Host Welcome Picnic September 1
item.description: Date: Sunday, September 1, 2024 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM - Join Rensselaer’s Chapel and Cultural Center for their annual Welcome Picnic featuring delicious BBQ food, live music, fun games, and activities for all ages! This is a perfect opportunity to meet new friends, connect with the community, and kick off the season with great company, so don’t miss out on the fun!
item.author: Students

item.title: Habitat for Humanity Offering Opportunity During Freshman Orientation
item.description: Date: Saturday, August 31, 2024 7:30 AM - 2:30 PM - In partnership with a local community chapter in Massachusetts, Rensselaer’s Habitat for Humanity Club will provide this “Beyond block” opportunity for freshmen, featuring an all-day build that will include lunch. No experience is necessary, but space is limited to 15, so register early! Participants need to bring long pants and closed-toe shoes/boots, and meet at 7:30AM at the Union horseshoe.
item.author: Students

item.title: Help Give the Gift of Life!
item.description: Date: Thursday, August 29, 2024 11:30 AM - 5:30 PM - Please take a minute to sign up for this blood drive, to be held in the Rensselaer Union’s Shelnutt Gallery and Ellsworth Room, located in rooms 3602 and 3606, respectively. For more info, follow @RPIUnion, stop by the Mueller Center, or contact Saurabh Rastogi.
item.author: Community

item.title: Nominations Sought for 2024 Founders Award of Excellence
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 3, 2024 (all day) - The Founders Award Committee is asking for assistance in identifying candidates for Rensselaer’s Founders Award of Excellence, which was established in 1994 to honor students who embody the qualities of creativity, discovery, and leadership, and the values of pride and responsibility at Rensselaer. Nominations should be submitted no later than September 3.
item.author: Community

item.title: BME Weinbaum Lecture to be Held August 29
item.description: Date: Thursday, August 29, 2024 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM - In his talk “Bioengineering Hydrogels for Regenerative Medicine,” Andrés J. García, Ph.D., Executive Director at the Petit Institute for Bioengineering and Bioscience Regents’ Professor in the Woodruff School of Mechanical Engineering at Georgia Tech, will discuss how hydrogels have emerged as powerful synthetic analogs of extracellular matrices for basic cell studies, as well as promising biomaterials for regenerative medicine applications.
item.author: Community

item.title: EMPAC Artist-in-Residence Laurie Anderson to Speak on “ARK”
item.description: Date: Thursday, August 29, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Renowned artist and musician Laurie Anderson opens the fall season at EMPAC with the free artist talk, “Building an ARK,” in which she reveals the process behind her newest major stage work, described as “a hallucinatory incantation on history and time, a dark comedy for the end of the world.” Anderson is at EMPAC for a final production residency in preparation for ARK’s November 2024 world premiere in Manchester, United Kingdom.
item.author: Community

item.title: Campus Community Invited to Cybersecurity Meetup with CISA, ISC2
item.description: Date: Wednesday, August 28, 2024 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM - All are welcome to join the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory and DotCIO in Academy Hall Auditorium for their monthly ISC2 Capital District NY chapter meeting. This month, Crystal Wilson, NY Cyber State Coordinator for CISA, will give a talk. Please contact Dr. Brian Callahan if you have questions.

item.title: Fac/Staff Webinar to Offer Tips for Incorporating Digital Story-Telling as Assignments
item.description:
Date: Thursday, August 29, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Maureen Fodera of Rensselaer’s Office of Undergraduate Education as she gives a high overview of the meaning of digital story-telling, discusses its advantages and assignment practices, and also reviews the Six-Word Story, Six Unique Shots assignment concept.
